tasks.task: Follow biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock.
subtasks: Check for designated entry points.
Contact farm for admission details.
Inspect truck and trailer by farm personnel.
Clean equipment if necessary.
Respond to facility entry requirements (e.g., signing logs, providing contact info).
Follow prescribed routes within the premises.
Verify required paperwork before loading/unloading (e.g., CVI, bill of lading, bill of sale).
Examine animals during loading/unloading and exclude sick/injured animals.
Double-check paperwork and secure gates after loading/unloading.
Admit to premises for delivery pickup or drop-off.
Follow farm-specific instructions for unloading and verifying animals.
Quarantine sick animals upon arrival.
Clean equipment after transport to prevent pathogen spread.

tasks.task: Examine required documentation for animal transportation.
subtasks: Check for certificate of veterinary inspection (CVI).
Confirm brand inspection certificate for cattle.
Verify bill of lading and bill of sale.

tasks.task: Properly handle sick or injured animals during transport.
subtasks: Identify sick/injured animals before loading/unloading.
Work with producers to isolate ill animals.
Coordinate animal examination and potential treatment.
Examine animals being loaded/unloaded.
Avoid loading sick or injured animals.
Confirm number and classes of animals loaded/unloaded.
Verify animal identification if applicable.
Log entry and exit times.
Maintain records of transport conditions and animal health.
Perform thorough clean-out when possible.
Hosedown equipment if necessary before departure.

tasks.task: Follow biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock
subtasks: ** Check for designated entry points ( farms with designated secure entry points for empty trucks)
** Contact farm for admission details ( phone number or sign with contact info)
** Inspect truck and trailer by farm personnel ( look for mud, manure, etc.)
** Clean equipment if necessary ( follow instructions to clean if contaminated)
** Respond to facility entry requirements ( sign logs, provide contact info, confirm equipment condition )
** Follow prescribed routes within the premises ( shown what route to take)
** Verify required paperwork before loading/unloading ( CVI, bill of lading, bill of sale )
** Examine animals during loading/unloading and exclude sick/injured animals ( don’t load sick or injured)
** Double-check paperwork and secure gates after loading/unloading ( confirm numbers and gates closed)
** Admit to premises for delivery pickup or drop-off ( call to gain admittance)
** Follow farm-specific instructions for unloading and verifying animals ( check numbers and IDs)
** Quarantine sick animals upon arrival ( work with producer to separate)
** Clean equipment after transport to prevent pathogen spread ( move to cleaning area or clean thoroughly)

tasks.task: Examine required documentation for animal transportation
subtasks: ** Check for certificate of veterinary inspection ( CVI)
** Confirm brand inspection certificate for cattle
** Verify bill of lading and bill of sale

tasks.task: Properly handle sick or injured animals during transport
subtasks: ** Identify sick/injured animals before loading/unloading
** Work with producers to isolate ill animals
** Coordinate animal examination and potential treatment
** Examine animals being loaded/unloaded
** Avoid loading sick or injured animals
** Confirm number and classes of animals loaded/unloaded
** Verify animal identification if applicable
** Log entry and exit times
** Maintain records of transport conditions and animal health
** Perform thorough clean-out when possible
** Hosedown equipment if necessary before departure
